boardgame.name: Zeitreise durch das 20. Jahrhundert
boardgame.description:
The game aims to encourage players to talk about certain topics. The players (2 players each as a team if there are more than 4 players) move their game pieces over an abstract plan with colour fields and collect colour cards. These cards can be used on communication fields with corresponding colours. Blue communication fields allow to describe a typical word from the 20th century and the other players have to guess this word. On red squares, players are asked to comment on one of 4 topics. Whoever has solved the tasks in all colours can enter the target field. Points are awarded for tasks solved, words guessed and the first player at the finish line.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Krimihaus
boardgame.description:
In a four-story house, a series of crimes happens that need to be solved. The players move through the house as investigating commissioners and search for the perpetrators on the basis of their written work assignments. The house can be variably rearranged for each game, so it always remains exciting. Reading comprehension, reading speed and reading are promoted playfully.

But also for children who are not yet reading, the game is not too short, because the cards are read to them.

Logical thinking and reasoning are trained, as the criminal is deduced from circumstantial evidence and the solution is determined.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Magus: Craft Focuses I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These subclasses were made for the Magus class.

The pack includes three new craft focuses for the Magus. The Arcane Duelist is based in increasing the durability of the Magus in combat, and allowing their spells to be consistently damaging to opponents. Clockwork Magecraft allows the Magus to store spells within gears, generate ether points from spell slots and to create a variety of gear on the spot for them and their allies. The trickster is an assassin-like Magus who can deal extra damage in opportune situations, weaken opponents and strike move around battle more quickly.

boardgame.name: Fat of the Lamb (Black Spear)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Hunger Must be Sated

Will you survive at the cost of your sanity?

Nerwig Whal stands upon a tall bluff, wind buffeting and blowing his cherry red hair. He clears it from his eyes. To the west, a long line of wagons winds its way towards him. It ascends further and further into the hills and will eventually come to a stop at the appointed place: A site ordained to produce fortune - or so he thinks. “These miners have few options for supplies,” he said. “It takes a bold man to claim a stronghold in these harsh hills … but we will do it. And we will be the sole supplier in these here hills. And we will laugh all the way to the bank!” Fat of the Lamb can be used in conjunction with other modules, with a different campaign, or as a one-shot adventure. Inside Fat of the Lamb you will find:

An adventure suitable for characters of 1st to 3rd level;
A dark fantasy adventure of survival and difficult choices;
An adventure compatible with Black Separ
Mental horrors

boardgame.name: Eera
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Races of Center Space 5: Eera is the newest volume in a series playable races for the 5th Edition rules of the world's most popular role-playing game.

This volume presents the Eera—amphibious humaniods with the ability to generate electricy.

Each race in the series is from the Center Space setting. While Center Space is a science fiction setting, the races can easily be used with other genres.

This book contains the racial traits and a new racial feat for the Eera, a new item, and a few suggestions for adapting it to other settings.

boardgame.name: W√ºrfle dich gesund
boardgame.description:
The game is about dealing with the appetite for apples, chocolate, cigarettes, alcohol, medications and drugs. First, you put together your game piece from cards. Turning them over reveals the inner life, the organism, of the character on which the "stimulants" circulate. In addition to the luck of the dice, tactics also play a role in determining whether the character is in bad shape or whether you can help him break bad habits or get a grip on his alcohol problems.

There are situations in which health is put at risk or promoted.
To win you must have done the following things:

you must have your own token on all the colored consumption playing fields
you must not have a token on any of the sickness playing fields
you must not have any more tokens on the black points or the supply bag
the products on the target fields must be converted into apples.


—user summary

boardgame.name: Cosmic Curses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Cursed Star Rises!

Cosmic Curses brings you a ton of amazing options to bring curses to your Starfinder Roleplaying Game campaign, with killer content for players and GMs alike. You’ll find accursed archetypes like the curseologist and cursed survivor, alongside curses for your heroes and villains to cast upon their enemies like hands of rust, pariah’s exile, and metallic slumber. You’ll also find a wide array of cursed objects and augmentations, including the ability to manufacture cursed items intentionally and how to incorporate magical technological, and hybrid technomagical cursed items like the alien hand and vanishing skin. You’ll also find rules for cursed starships (watch out for gremlins!) and accursed locations like impending doom, obsession’s grasp, and the curse of flowing blood. If you've ever wanted to inspire true terror in your sci-fi heroes who thought curses were just a bad superstition, pick up this 28-page Starfinder Roleplaying Game supplement today and Make Your Game Cursed... and Legendary!

boardgame.name: Fillion Manor: Legacy of a Fallen Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the aftermath of the mid-summer festival, our heroes find themselves detained to explain the disturbance that happened. After everything else that has occurred, what else could possibly happen?

Find out in Fillion Manor: Legacy of a Fallen Knight! This time, players will gain one of several new mystical weapons for use with the pre-generated characters from Shadow of Fillion Manor or their own new Veteran rank characters.

boardgame.name: Hoardreach (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rearing against the sky, the lord of all it surveys, the place once known as Shear Cliff has been transformed. Once little more than a lonely mountain, the last survivor of a range that was destroyed by cataclysm and disaster, the sky island has been remade into a thing of wonder. Circled by wyvern riders, night fliers, and skyships, Hoardreach's lights can be seen for a hundred miles as they draw travelers and pilots toward it.

Perhaps the greatest wonder of Hoardreach, though, are the Founders. Five dragons who banded together initially for control of a larger territory, they've unfurled their wings to shelter dozens of towns and villages beneath the shadow of their city. Their strength laid the foundation for Hoardreach, and it is their scales, their breath, and their very Wyrm Mark that has helped the city become what it is today!

The City of Wyrms is a place where danger and miracles walk hand-in-hand. Where creatures often called "monsters" make their homes, and build their own lives under the rule of the Lex Draconis. A place where the purple-plumed dragon knights stand their vigil, and where schemes and plots are hatched in secret everyday. A flap of a dragon's wings in Hoardreach can send fortunes spinning half a world away, and it is where the outcast, the brave, and the sly come to find their own adventures.

"Hoardreach: The City of Wyrms" is a supplement for Sundara: Dawn of a New Age, but it can also be added to any existing game or setting! This particular supplement includes:

City map and history of Hoardreach.
District-by-district breakdown, including unique locations, notable NPCs, and rumors.
Rules for dragons in Sundara, as well as unique items like the scale suit, the dragon knight archetype, and the unique powers that comes with bearing a dragon's Wyrm Mark.
GM advice section for how to get the most out of using Hoardreach in your game!
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Battle of Lissa Supplement
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Lissa and The Crimean War.

These also include fortifications and shore bombardments and include ship sheets by pdf for Italy, Austria, Russia, Britain and France as well as the major forts in Sevastopol.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for British, French and Italian ships, reload counters and speed counters available from publisher.

You don't need the main Ironclads 1860-1918 rules to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1

boardgame.name: Mo√ºd (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rising from the midst of the Trackless Quarter, Moüd looks like a mirage at first. A bustling city surrounded by empty wastes of dry dust seems like a fairy tale, but Moüd is very real. The ancient structure, lost for nearly a thousand years, has been reclaimed thanks to the tireless efforts of the Silver Wraiths. The city is the headquarters of this guild of gray-clad necromancers, and for nearly a century now it has grown and prospered under their stewardship… and with the labor of their undead servants to tend to the city’s needs.

Moüd is a place of contradiction. It is civilization in the midst of a desert of empty, dead land. It is a place of life, but it lives cheek-by-jowl with death. It is filled with ancient history, but also brims with everything the modern-day has to offer. And amidst the buzzing markets and clattering bones there is still adventure to be had. For though the City of Bones may appear tame, there is more going on just beneath the surface.

"Moüd: The City of Bones" is the second installment in the Sundara: Dawn of a New Age setting. However, the city can be easily adapted for use in existing campaigns and settings as well!

This supplement includes:

City map and history of Moüd
District-by-district breakdown including unique locations, notable NPCs, and rumors
The alternative system for "necromantic taint" and its effects on long-term exposure
Rules for playing the Half-Dead, a new PC species spawned by the powers of death
An archetype for the Deathstalker, the elite martial arm of the Silver Wraiths guild
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Silkgift (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With hundreds of windmills catching the breezes that blow off of Weaver's Bay, Silkgift looks like it might break away from the hills and chart its own course to the sea at any moment. While many sailors have made this observation in jest, there is always someone who shushes them, lest the city's ingeneurs decide to take the suggestion as a challenge.

Though Silkgift was founded on spinning and weaving Archer cloth, the place's true stock in trade is innovation. Every aspect of life, from growing food, to making clothes, to travel, has been improved by the Ingeneurium, as well as the countless inventors, tinkerers, and entrepreneurs who have flocked to the city over the years. While the unique goods and strange items Silkgift produces in addition to its famous sailcloth may have been enough to put it on the map, cutting a massive canal through the mountains that removed months of travel around a peninsula made them a major center of trade, transit, and innovation.

The City of Sails is a place where some of the brightest lights burn… but the brighter the light, the darker the shadows it casts. From secretive agents to snatch the latest discoveries before they're made public, to saboteurs looking to hobble Silkgift's progress to enrich themselves, there are perils aplenty. But for those with quick wits and fast hands, peril could quickly become opportunity… if you have the courage to face it, that is.

"Silkgift: The City of Sails" is meant for use with Sundara: Dawn of a New Age, but this supplement can also be adapted for use in an existing game! This particular supplement includes:

City map and history of Silkgift.
District-by-district breakdown, including notable NPCs, unique locations, and rumors to discoveries
Rules for unique items like aether weapons, net casters and Archer brigandine armor
GM advice section for getting the most out of Silkgift as a setting for your game
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Cult of Skadi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Skadi, the Nordic goddess of mountains and winter.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
Information on Skadi's shrines and sacred groves
The Archer's Feast and other festivals held in Skadi's honor
Skadi's children
A new spell, Arctic Essence
The Oath of Mountain's Calling, which Skadi's paladins take.

boardgame.name: Creepy Crawlies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creepy Crawlies joins Praise His Name and other titles in the Unspeakable Things series. Like its predecessors, this entry wraps a story around a monster wholly conceived and created by an artist. Here, my friend and regular contributor to Shadow of the Demon Lord products, Jack Kaiser, confronted his own fears of all things arachnid and presented me with a nasty little spider creature that lives inside the body of a human victim. I love this piece, shown on the next page, as the thing looks to be bursting out from some dark, nasty place, dripping and flailing about for its next victim. Jack’s monstrous creation inspired a delightful and sinister threat that might work as a chance encounter for groups traveling through the Northern Reach or for an entire adventure designed to expose the creepy crawlies before their infestation spreads.

boardgame.name: Decadent Town (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the decadent towns in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Here Start the Kingdom of Baphomet
Ici commence le royaume de Baphomet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Old legends about treasures and sacred relics start
resurfacing in the small port town of Paphos,
After a construction site uncovered previously unknown tunnels
located under the ancient Templar fortress...


Les vieilles légendes parlant de trésors et de reliques sacrées
refont surface dans la petite ville portuaire de Paphos,
après que des travaux aient mis au jour des tunnels jusque là inconnues,
situés sous l'ancienne forteresse des Templiers...
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Here Start the Kingdom of Baphomet PDF
Ici commence le royaume de Baphomet PDF

boardgame.name: Scout: Komm mit zum Einkaufen!
boardgame.description:
Whew, let's go shopping!
Have the shopping list and the money ready and off you go to the store. Fruit, vegetables, milk or bread - depending on where the character is, one thing can be obtained from the shopping list. The seller says what the goods cost. The first player to buy all the things on their shopping list wins this game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Mystery House: Adventures in a Box ‚Äì The Lost Ship
Mystery House: Das verlassene Raumschiff
Mystery House: Perdus dans l'Espace
boardgame.description:
You’re on a distant planet, you see a spaceship in front of you, but no traces of life. Your oxygen is running low.
You have no choice: you must enter!
An apparently uncontrolled ship lost in the deep space and a mysterious Artificial Intelligence — all of this awaits in The Lost Ship, a SCI-FI themed adventure for Mystery House.

Solve all the riddles, and take back the control of the ship!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mystery House: Adventures in a Box

boardgame.name: Savaged Pardners Vol. 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Western Pre-Gens!

This fourth volume of Savaged Pardners contains six (6) pre-generated Wild Card templates, ready for use in any Savage Worlds Western game, along with four (4) Extra designs.

The Wild Cards can be used by players as the heroes of an adventure, or they could become NPC adversaries. The four Extras are most likely to make an appearance in town, but there's no tellin' where they may turn up. The Dog House Gang reckons that a Judge (that’s GM to city slickers) can put these characters to good use at the drop of a hat.

Vol. 4 includes six Heroic rank Wild Cards with thirteen Advances each, and four Novice Extras with one Advance each.

Maverick (WC)
Big Bug (WC)
Sharpshooter (WC)
Marshal (WC)
Grifter (WC)
Prizefighter (WC)
Rancher, Barber, Tailor, Scrivener (Extras)

boardgame.name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Pre Dreadnought Wars Supplement
boardgame.description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: Pre Dreadnought Wars Supplement cover from the Spanish American wars, The Sino Japanese wars and TsuShima and include crew quality and ships sheets by pdf.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for Japan, Russia, China, Spain, Britain and America ships, reload counters and speed counters available by email from publisher.

Several ship models are available from the publisher.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1

boardgame.name: Demons of Pugmire
boardgame.description: The Unseen are a recuring theme in the Realms of Pugmire as are the dangers of being possessed by these evil creatures. There is not much explanation of what happens when a character is possessed as most of the Unseen given are the results of a long-term possession. This tome will define the scope of possession and provide some examples of long and short-term possessions.
boardgame.rpghonor: 2021 RPG Geek 24 Hour RPG Supplement Winner

boardgame.name: The Surrogate
boardgame.description:
Adventure Hook:

A news story of a dozen dead at a remote location, by all indications a wild animal somehow broke free. A contact of the hunters knew better; this was a lab, funded by the Royce Foundation. No one knows what they were researching.

boardgame.description:
Crimes have taken place all over the city, and you want to figure out exactly what's happened, so you'll need to look closely at the giant city map (75 x 110 cm) to find all the hidden information and trace the trails of those who had it in for their foes.

MicroMacro: Crime City – Full House includes 16 cases for you to solve. Each case includes a number of cards that ask you to find something on the map or uncover where someone has gone or otherwise reveal information relevant to a case. The city map serves as a map in time as well as space, so you'll typically find people in multiple locations throughout the streets and buildings, and you need to piece together what happened, whether by going through the case card by card or by reading only the starting card in the case and trying to figure out everything that happened for yourself. Will you be able to answer all questions about the case without fail?

Unlike the original MicroMacro: Crime City, Full House marks each case with symbols so that parents can decide which cases the youngest investigators are cleared to research.

[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size]
[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=14][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size] I also sell smaller items on BGG here: https://boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/europa_major?pageid=1

I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

boardgame.name: strategie
boardgame.description:
One player has the task of arming Austria and defending it successfully at the national borders against a deployment of the Western and Eastern powers (2 other players).
The available units are divided into infantry, pioneers, artillery, tanks, transport vehicles and aircraft with different moving ranges. Austria starts with 11 units of infantry and can gain new units if the Austrian Parliament agrees (random decision). The Western and Eastern powers must each combine their initially scattered units into formations and march to the Austrian border.
The Western and Eastern powers win if Austria cannot stop a march on the border. Austria wins if the last parliamentary decision has been taken.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Intel
boardgame.description:
Intel is a simple yet highly strategic card game about tracking the Agent card and leading others off its trail. Take turns playing cards to uproot information on others or sabotage them by stealing and swapping cards. Score points by correctly voting for who has the Agent at the end of the round. Whoever has the Agent itself scores even more points, but only if they successfully lead others off their trail!

As the end of round approaches, the stakes get higher and higher—every action taken affects who ends up with the Agent card, as well as who might know its location! Deceive your friends with mind games, reverse psychology, and other strategic plays to maximize your points.

That’s just the tip of the iceberg—keep an eye out for stray point cards, the valuable Asset card, the elusive Double Agent, and much more…

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Faceless Ghoul
boardgame.description:
A class for Mörk Borg.

From the description:

The Faceless Ghoul is a dead person, but they're somehow still sucking air (barely) and if they can find travel companions bold enough to stomach their haunting visages, they make a great addition to any doomed adventuring party at the end of the world!

boardgame.name: Take It Serious: Stadt Land Unseri√∂s
boardgame.description:
Categories / scattergories board game with 72 different and innovative categories for great fun, played according to the classical scattergories rules. The aim is to collect as many points per round as possible in order to win the game after 12 rounds. But beware, there might be two winners in the end: one with the most points and the player who has best predicted his target number of points before the start of the game.

Das Stadt, Land, Fluss Spiel mit 72 abwechslungsreichen, lustigen und innovativen Kategorien für großen Spielspaß. Verpackt in einem praktischen DIN-A4 Block mit 50 Spielbögen. Gespielt wird nach den klassischen Stadt, Land, Fluss Regeln. Ziel ist es, möglichst viele Punkte je Runde zu sammeln, um das Spiel nach 12 Runden zu gewinnen. Doch Achtung es gewinnen zwei Spieler, der mit den meisten Punkten und der Spieler, der vor Beginn des Spiels seine Zielpunktzahl am besten vorhergesagt hat.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: The Search for Professor Kutil
De verdwenen ru√Ønes van Arnak: De zoektocht naar professor Kutil
Die verlorene Ruinen von Arnak: Die Suche nach Professor Kutil
boardgame.description:
Find out what happened to professor Kutil and his missing team in this free, four-chapter solo campaign for Lost Ruins of Arnak. Available at https://arnak.game

The famous scholar's expedition vanished somewhere in the uncharted waters of the Pacific Ocean—while searching for a mysterious island nobody believed existed. It seems the professor may have found what he was looking for, but what happened to his expedition? Only scarce traces of the team’s presence remain, but nothing truly explains where they are or what happened to them.

Discover the story of the lost expedition while beating your former student-turned-rival, who arrived on the island with her own unknown agenda, making your search for professor Kutil and his team more complicated.

To play the campaign, you will need a copy of Lost Ruins of Arnak and access to our free web application, which will guide you through the campaign setup, rules, and story. The app is playable on both computers and mobile devices. If you don’t want to play the campaign with the app, you can print it out with a free print-and-play file.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Thieves' Quests: The Early Bird
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thieves' Quests: The Early Bird is a fully illustrated 5E Adventure that can be used as a standalone quest or can be plugged easily in your existing TTRPG campaign. It comes with maps, tokens and a little (digital) booklet that describes the adventure setup. Are your players smart enough to break in and deconstruct the clever way secret agent Elouise Ashglade hides her important files?

boardgame.name: Travelling & Caravans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travelling & Caravans is a fully illustrated supplement that helps the Game Master prepare for travelling sessions, as well as provide the GM with the tools they need to have the party become part of or lead a bigger caravan of NPC's.

boardgame.name: Lanzadera Shuttle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lanzadera is one of the unsung heroes of modern commerce. Whether delivering cargo to orbit, bringing the workforce to shipyards or delivering packaged meals to space ports, the Lanzadera is always there, working hard in the background.

Operating a shuttle can give you lots of interesting opportunities for adventure in one planetary system. Perhaps the local thugs want you to launder money? The military want you to support their fleet operations, or the metal mining company offers you a contract to deliver a service to their refinery. Can you keep your staff happy and still make money? What do you do when you reputation drops and your staff leave?

You get details and deck plans for four versions, the basic cargo model, a 50 seat passenger shuttle and two long range models; one cargo ship, one for passengers.

boardgame.name: Sumos al Ataque
boardgame.description:
Every year the best sumos fighters meet, in search of winning 2 of 3 matches, a card game that simulates sumos fights, pushes your rival, knocks him down, gets energy by eating, and prevents the referee from disqualifying you for doing trap.

How do you play? Each player chooses three actions, has two meeples (sumos), and a maximum of four cards in hand, from which they draw from a deck and discard the ones they use.

How do the players do the actions described with the cards?
With the cards moving to his meeple (sumo), he can attack, push, knock down, cheat, he can also draw a card or reserve it to play later.

How do you win?
There are three victory conditions, the one who takes the sumo off the floor, the one who shoots a sumo twice, the one who gets caught cheating.

Cada año los mejores peleadores de sumos se reúnen, en busca de ganar 2 de 3 enfrentamientos, un juego de cartas que simula las peleas de sumos, empuja a tu rival, derríbalo, obtén energía comiendo, y evita que el arbitro te descalifique por hacer trampa.

¿Cómo se juega? Cada jugador escoge tres acciones, cuenta con dos meeples (sumos), y cuatro cartas máximo en mano, de las cuales va sacando de un mazo y descartan las que usen.

¿Cómo hacen los jugadores las acciones descritas con las cartas?
Con las cartas mueven a su meeple (sumo), puede atacar, empujar, derribar, hacer trampa, también puede sacar carta o reservarla para jugar después.

¿Cómo se gana?
hay tres condiciones de victoria, el que saque al sumo de la duela, el que tire dos veces a un sumo, el que lo cachen haciendo trampa.

boardgame.name: The City of a Thousand Minarets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cairo!

The Conquerer City. The City of a Thousand Minarets. The Victorious. For a millennia, Cairo has stood on the banks of the Nile as a succession of foreign rulers came then faded into the sands of history.

The City of a Thousand Minarets is a guide to the pulp fiction Cairo of 1930s for the Ubiquity Role Playing system that powers Hollow Earth Expedition and other role playing games. From the crowded back alleys where con men hawk counterfeit antiquities to the Egyptian Museum, from the coffeeshops and social clubs of the new boulevards to the ancient necropolises of the Old City, the points of interest are presented. The politics, culture, significant figures, and the archeology of the pulp era Cairo are explored.

Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1 This set of rules includes one scenario for each of the following sets of rules, Ironclads 1860 to 1918:

Lissa and the Crimea,
American Civil war,
South American wars of independence,
Pre dreadnought wars,
Turkey in the black sea ,
The gulf of Riga 1917.


There are some additional rules and ship sheets included in this set.

boardgame.name: Fast Play WWI Fleet Actions: Jutland 1918 Scenario
boardgame.description:
These rules are for use with very large scale fleet actions. They give the possibility of refighting an action as large as the battle of Jutland in just a few hours.
They include full information to fight with the ships that existed at the time in the squadrons they were actually in.
Counter sets for each squadron are available by email once you have bought the rules.

What if Jutland had been refought in 1918 as the German High Command wanted to.
By this time both fleets were vastly different to those that fought at Jutland in 1916.
The British had 12 major warships with 15” guns and the Germans had their own 15” gunned dreadnoughts available. The British also had two whole units of aircraft carriers with torpedo dropping planes. The Germans had shore based aircraft and Zeppelins.
Rules include all ships in the Grand fleet and the High Seas Fleet as they were in 1918 as well as aircraft, submarines and aircraft carriers.

A PDF file of ship counters is also available by email from the publisher.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fast Play WWI Fleet Actions: Mediterranean Navies Scenario
boardgame.description:
These rules are for use with very large scale fleet actions. They give the possibility of refighting an action as large as the battle of Jutland in just a few hours.
They include full information to fight with the ships that existed at the time in the squadrons they were actually in. Counter sets for each squadron are available by email once you have bought the rules.

These cover all the navies of the Mediterranean including navies of France, Italy, Austria Hungry, Turkey and some British and German ships.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Age of Dogfights: WWII
boardgame.description:
The game depicts air battles during WWII in a very realistic way. A special quality of the game are the altitude stands that are easy to handle. The game covers the period of the war from 1942 to 1945 in Europe, when the USA became heavily involved in the war. The game uses the Triangle system, which is very flexible and allows many optional rules to be applied. The mechanics of the game allow simulation of battles with a large number of individual aircraft, with a fluid gameplay.

The game may seem too simple at first sight, as most of the mechanics are numbers (speed, agility, firepower, etc.) which are modified by dice and several factors. However, while being easy to use, the basically simple mechanics form a very realistic set of physics, which simulate velocity, direction changing (both horizontal and vertical) and damage inflicted by firing.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

boardgame.name: Aldarra
boardgame.description:
Welcome back to the vibrant world of Sordane – a massive and sprawling setting of diverse nations, cunning crime syndicates, bustling economies, and adventure everywhere! Lost more than 300 years ago to a powerful convergence storm, Aldarra was left uninhabitable. Centuries later, the chaotic magical energies began to finally subside. Now, Aldarra is being claimed by those seeking wealth, land, and power. Suddenly, nations from all over Sordane’s largest continent, Bordair, are sending fleets out. The first to stake their claim will reap the benefits; the power, the advancement, the riches, but who will emerge victorious?

In Aldarra, you play as one of four mighty factions, warring for control of this long lost nation. Each Faction has its strengths, and its history, within the lore of Bordair. 3-4 players will select their faction and take as many paths as they can to emerge the new rulers of Aldarra.
Use your fleets to exterminate your opponents. Complete secondary objectives and build up victory points as you venture forth from your stronghold to explore new territories, expand your control. Manage and extract the resources and Sordalite crystals you need to grow, replenish, and upgrade your forces. Strategically use the unique abilities of your faction to out maneuver your opponents, and gain control of this magical land.

Aldarra will feature over 150 massive and finely detailed minis,randomly generated hex tile maps and variable starting positions that demand dynamic tactics from turn one and ensure no two games are the same.

boardgame.name: Animals and Legends Card Game
boardgame.description:
Animals & Legends is a clever new card game created by a father and son team. This is a deck-building game with a twist that allows from 2 to 4 players to engage in friendly competition with the winner being the last one with their collection of animal cards.

The essence of Animals & Legends is to create a team animals an mythical creatures and then pit them against your opponent in battle. All players can create teams filled with fun, exciting creatures and duke it out using a little luck along with enough strategy to keep the interest of kids and adults alike. You win the game by destroying or stealing animal cards that are held by opposing players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: „Ç±„Éº„Çø„Ç§Â∞ëÂ•≥ÔΩûMNP„Åô„Çã„Åã„ÇâÈáë„Çí„Åè„Çå„Å£! (Give me money because I'm MNP! )
boardgame.description:
In Give me money, players get smartphones for free with the MNP (Mobile Number Portability). You need to trick the portability system to get smartphones for free. The players are kids who will try to take advantage of the system and earn money by changing phone companies.

We are playing with three different operators (colors). Each of them will offer phones to pick up when taking out contracts. These phones have different values and therefore will be more or less attractive to gamers.

The cards are separated by operators and form three piles. At the start of the game a market is created by drawing as many cards as there are players in each operator deck (with two players two cards per operator so six in total).

A round is made up of several phases. The game ends when you can no longer replenish the market. The final count is simple: add the yen tokens (1 point each) and the value of the cards and the winner is the one with the most points.

Possibly a spin-off from the Keitai Shoujo romance game app.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Cinder Shire
boardgame.description:
Cinder Shire is a competitive collection game made for 2 to 4 players.

You and your friends have all received a letter with an offer of glorious treasures and wealth to the first one to complete a full collection of magically imbued artifacts.

In Cinder Shire, you and your friends will delve deep into a magical abandoned dungeon that can imbue lost artifacts with its magic.

Every Attempt to map out the dungeon has lead to failure, some say that the magic makes the walls shift when no living soul is within.

Be the first to complete a full gear set and claim the key to the castle and all that lies within.

But be careful the dungeon can sense your presence, each time you enter, the dungeon will react.

Use the magical items you've collected to your advantage or to your friends' disadvantage.

Cinder Shire comes with 19 different consumable cards 54 unique gear cards each providing a unique ability or effects all with custom-made high fidelity artwork especially made to make Cinder Shire the most unique board game on the market
Each game has been carefully assembled to provide the most immersive experience of a fantasy medieval experience.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aduanas y aranceles
boardgame.description:
Game of economy, about world trade, ships, exports and imports, empires are destroyed and now they are forced to trade to prosper, they have been transformed into countries, each one has a resource, to trade.

How do you play and win the game?
Each country produces a resource, has two ships, each one has a personal board with its customs area and character card. The objective is to send ships to other countries to buy resources, or if you go to islands you can steal resources, and then unload them at customs, these resources are exchanged for resource cards, the first country that collects three cards wins.

How do players trade?
If a ship arrives in a country, it has the option of buying resources, which are guided by the market price. If there are many resources it will be sold cheaply and if there are few resources it will be sold high.

What are the players doing?
Each player must send ships, to gather the resources or play the event cards (war, tariffs, exchange) that will serve to ruin the plans of the other countries, when you gather the resources that the resource cards ask for, you take it.

Juego de economía, sobre comercio mundial, barcos, exportaciones e importaciones, los imperios están destruidos y ahora están obligados a comerciar para prosperar, se han transformado en países.

¿Cómo se juega y gana el juego?
cada país produce un recurso, cuenta con dos barcos, cada uno tiene un tablero personal con su zona de aduana y carta de personaje. El objetivo es enviar barcos a otros países para comprar recursos, o si va a islas puede robar recursos, para después descargarlos en la aduana, estos recursos se canjean por unas cartas de recursos, el primer país que junte tres cartas gana.

¿Cómo comercian los jugadores?
si un barco llega a un país tiene la opción de comprar recursos, los cuales se guían por el precio del mercado, si hay muchos recursos se venderá barato y si hay pocos recursos se venderá caro.

¿Lo que hacen los jugadores?
cada jugador deberá enviar barcos, para juntar los recursos o jugar las cartas de evento (guerra, aranceles, intercambio) que servirán para arruinar los planes de los demás países, cuando juntes los recursos que pide las cartas de recursos, te la llevas.

boardgame.name: All-Star Wrestling: The Wrestling Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to All-Star Wrestling, the role-playing game that takes you into the world of professional wrestling, where every match is a main event. Here body slams, suplexes, and headlocks determine how tough you are, and if you've got the intestinal fortitude to go after the ultimate prize... The World Heavyweight Championship!

To play All-Star Wrestling you will need 6-sided dice, 10-sided dice, paper, pencil, and this rulebook, along with the courage, stamina and skill to be one of us - the best.

So get ready to play the greatest wrestling you'll ever find!
boardgame.rpg: All-Star Wrestling: The Wrestling Role-Playing Game

boardgame.description:

A merger of the events of the 19th and 20th September.

boardgame.name: „Å∫„Åü„Å∫„Åü (Petapeta)
boardgame.description:
„Å∫„Åü„Å∫„Åü (Petapeta) is an area majority game where the players attach stickers to seven areas on a sheet of paper. The game includes several board variations, and the areas of each board are different sizes for different player counts.

The actions in the game center around a rondel. Each space allows the player to place one or two stickers in a single area on this game's board. Some stickers are a player's color and others are a neutral color.

The game ends when all players cannot place additional stickers. Points are earned for the number of large colored stickers placed; number of different areas with colored stickers; and most colored stickers in each area. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 01
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grab a set of percentile dice (d100) to give a random character or you can find a character at the correct level for your adventure.
...
Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 02
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grab a set of percentile dice (d100) to give a random character or you can find a character at the correct level for your adventure.

Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

boardgame.name: It's 5pm
boardgame.description:
In "It's 5pm", the players are salaryworkers commuting to and from work, and they like to relax on their commute: bars, movies, malls, and board game cafes!

The game takes place on a city grid that the players expand as the game progresses. Players will spend money on their leisure time pursuits, and earn more money at work.

There is only so much time in the day, and the players will need to determine how long to work each day and how much time can be devoted to other interests.

The winner will be the player who has earned the most happiness by Friday!

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceship Quirks - Vol 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spaceships are like special homes for a crew that can last for decades at a time. And all good captains quickly learn to alter their ship to fit their particular needs, personality and aesthetic. And over time, these choices can alter the very programming and infrastructure of any space vessel. For better or worse.

This list is intended for any space opera setting (like Traveller, Star Wars, Star Trek, Space Opera, Rifts, Babylon 5, Red Dwarf, etc.) where technology is not necessarily uniform or simple. This list can be applied to shuttles, passenger vessels, mining ships, smugglers, cargo crafts, dreadnaughts, and so on. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next bucket of bolts.

boardgame.name: Oishida Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small village, nestled within out-of-season rice patties. Dirt paths wind their way throughout the village and surrounding ponds, while a wooden bridge leads out of the area.
Lamps line the walkways, and many storage barrels and crates can be found within the village itself. Some of the roofs for the huts are tiled, while others have been thatched with rice straw.

boardgame.name: Tagami Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small Eastern village, nestled within a bamboo forest and fortified with a wall of sharpened timber. Dirt paths wind their way throughout the village and surrounding trees, while a wooden bridge crosses a small blue pond.
Lamps line the walkways, and many storage barrels and crates can be found within the village itself. Some of the roofs for the huts are tiled, while others have been thatched with straw from rice that’s seasonally grown in the pond nearby.

Adventure Seed

After a weary day of travel, you arrive in the small farming village of Tagami. Children frolic around the town battling each other with short bamboo swords, while elders converse with older peasants hauling rice grain via wheelbarrows. Kindly folk, they invite you in for the night and feed you soup with rice, vegetables and fish. Soon after, you head to bed for some much-needed sleep.
Sometime after midnight a loud noise outside wakes you up. Investigating, you find three well-armed men standing over an elder who has been pushed to the ground. The armed men are demanding rice and dried goods, but the old man apologizes and tells them that the villagers have already given all they can spare last time they came. That, if they were to give any more, they would surely starve.
The largest of the armed men gives the elder an ultimatum. Either the village collects the necessary food for them in the next week, or his group will make them regret it.
If you engage the men they’ll lie to your face; claiming the army has requisitioned the food. But in actuality these men are deserters turned bandits—and only a small amount of the greater gang. If you fight, the men will attempt to flee and return to the others, or die in combat. If this happens, all the bandits will return in three days. But, if you allow the bandits to leave without conflict, they will only return in seven days, as earlier promised.
Once the bandits have either left peacefully, fled, or been killed, the elder will beg you to teach his people to fight like you do or—at the very least—help protect the village when the bandits return.
If you choose to help teach the villagers to fight, you may teach them any skills you know at base level, as well as grant one villager per three days one level in whatever class you are.
When the bandits return, depending on your efforts to reinforce the town and what you’ve taught the villagers will determine your success in driving away the deserters.

boardgame.name: Izu's Pirate Isle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small pirate village, nestled on a sandy isle behind a colorful reef. Blue and red coral grow on rocky shelves beneath the waves, while fish dart out between green anemones and seaweed.
Paths wind their way throughout the village, while multiple wooden piers lead out into the surf. The town itself is fortified by a tall fence of sharpened poles, and many storage barrels and crates can be found within. Some of the roofs for the huts are tiled, while others have been thatched with bamboo from the surrounding trees.

boardgame.name: Battle of Tagami Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small, Eastern village in flames, nestled within a bamboo forest and fortified with a wall of sharpened timber. Dirt paths—many covered with bloody corpses—wind their way throughout the village and surrounding trees, while a wooden bridge crosses a small blue pond.
Lamps line the walkways, and many storage barrels and crates can be found within the village itself. Some of the roofs for the huts are tiled, while others have been thatched with straw from rice that’s seasonally grown in the pond nearby.

boardgame.name: Underdark Fungi Tunnels
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark tunnels open up to a wide cavern, illuminated by glowing red and purple fungi that cling to the damp stone walls. Natural bridges cross above a chasm that descends into darkness, while sticky cobwebs run between rock formations.
The cavern walls are also lined with the fungi, while purple and red tubular plants glow eerily on the walkways.
Sand and crumbling stone crunch underfoot, and clacking noises echo up from the darkness below...

boardgame.name: Glowing Alien Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Alien trees with purple leaves and green flowers cling to a series of steep, seemingly-bottomless cliffs that descend into mist. Giant red and purple disk-shaped plants grow on their sides, amid rocks and jagged outcrops.
Strange, tubular purple and red growths line stony walkways atop of them, glowing eerily, while ruddy wildflowers cluster at their base. Fallen rocks crunch underfoot, and strange calls echo throughout the canyons.

boardgame.name: Underdark Magma Chambers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark tunnels open up to a wide cavern, illuminated by pools of glowing magma that lap against charred stone cliffs. Red and purple fungi cling to the walls, while natural bridges cross the sizzling pools below.
The cavern walls are also lined with the fungi, while purple and red tubular plants glow eerily on the warm walkways.

boardgame.name: Glowing Alien Lake
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Alien trees with green flowers cling to a series of steep cliffs that descend into a glowing, purple body of water. It’s filled with schools of fish, disk shaped pink and violet plants, and leads down into darkness.
Naturally formed stone bridges reach out across the liquid, lined with strange, tubular purple and red growths that glow eerily. Ruddy wildflowers cluster at their base, amid rocks and jagged outcrops.
Fallen stones crunch underfoot, while the fish occasionally fly out of the water; calling strangely before diving in again.

boardgame.name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters!
boardgame.description:
Beat to Quarters is an official expansion to Flying Colors by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game (preferably the latest deluxe edition) to play.

One of the most common criticisms of Flying Colors is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 562 individually named ships included with the latest, deluxe version of Flying Colors. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Flying Colors. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Flying Colors. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the battle of Trafalgar without the space requirements for three game maps.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Flying Colors!

—description from the publisher

Beat to Quarters can be purchased from:

Volume I - Flying Colors
Volume II - Serpents-of-the-Seas
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flying Colors

boardgame.name: Quest Calendar: The Gates of Terralon
boardgame.description:
An rpg built into a desktop calendar. Choose one of 6 heroes. Go on a campaign that lasts throughout the year with a single event happening each day. Chose how you want to take on the daily challenge. Roll classic rpg dice (7 polyhedral dice) and add your hero's abilities to fight the monster, open the chest, get past guards, etc.

—description from the designer

Years of war and turmoil caused the Gods to separate their worlds from one another, but this did not stop the fighting. The demon's were dealt a devastating blow when their gate was destroyed. The consequences were unexpected. Now, demons pour forth and spill into other worlds, wrecking havoc across existence.

Elsewhere in Terralon, the King's Festival approaches. Many come from afar to compete in the yearly tournament. The title of Lord, and the riches and land which accompany said title, can be won in this competition. Even the poorest commoners has a chance at glory.

Will you compete in the tournament at the King's Festival and earn the title of Lord? Can you stop the demon invasion and prevent the collapse of all worlds? Enjoy as the story unfolds in this adventure-a-day desktop calendar.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Metal Mickey: All Around the House Game
boardgame.description:
Each player receives 13 figures to be placed on a 6x6 board (the house) with point from 3 to 8. The figures are placed alternately. They have to be placed horizontally or vertically in line with the previous figure. No other piece may be on this line. As soon as a player can no longer place a piece according to the rules, the other player wins the game with as many points as the last square he occupied. The player to score at least 17 points by winning several games wins the match.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Blumenwiese
boardgame.description:
The players are walking on the flower meadow and want to pick flowers. Before one can be taken away, however, a flower of the same color must first be brought to bloom in another part of the meadow.

When all the flowers have been picked, the game is over. Whoever has picked the most flowers is the winner. If the number is the same, the corresponding players have won together.

—user summary

boardgame.name: HypoVision
boardgame.description:
The players move their game pieces across 3 islands and are asked questions on the topics of economy, banking, sport, art, environment and "Hypo-Bank", the correct answers to which earn points. Changing the islands increases the multiplier for the points paid out (1x, 2x, 3x). In addition, there are events that influence the score. The game ends after a previously agreed playing time or when a certain score has been reached by a player. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sandwich Masters: Bread Roles
boardgame.description:
Bread Roles brings an added layer of chaos to the classic Sandwich Masters experience by introducing 10 new role cards, each of which boasts unique game-bending powers. What's more, Bread Roles allows six people to play together for the first time by adding extra cards to the core game.

Assume the identity of the Undercover Health Inspector, Flavatron 5000 or Colin the Bear (among others) and let battle commence. Your name may have changed but the challenge remains the same: defeat your rivals and become the one true Sandwich Master!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sandwich Masters

boardgame.name: Passengers
boardgame.description:
On the riverbanks of Limbo, cloaked and masked individuals patiently wait for a sign from you. At a wave of your hand, you will place them in one of the boats that are bobbing on the oddly colored water below.

Most of these figures are honest and good Souls that try to reach the eternal bliss of the Afterlands beyond. Some, however, are devious Demons that hope to get smuggled across by one of your corrupted colleagues!

So who do you trust and why? Which boat can be safely sent out?
Or maybe it's you that is working in secret with the other Demon smugglers in play...

Each round, passengers are placed facedown in one of two boats. When placed, unique Gifts are collected that will help their owner to figure out who might be trusted and which boat will score highest for their team. Finally, all players will vote on the boat that they will sent out to the Afterlands.

Passengers is a game of tactical communication, about knowing when to share information and when to remain silent. When to be honest and when to bluff in order for your team to win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mobility
boardgame.description:
The aim of the game is to keep greenhouse gas emissions from transport as low as possible in real-life examples. The means of transport available in the game are bicycle, train, underground, tram, ferry, electric car, bus, hybrid car, conventional car or plane, each of which has its specific CO2 equivalent per person-kilometre. The players should now find a suitable solution for the annual mileage in a case study of a fictitious person (commute to work, holidays, leisure time, excursions). The player or game group that proposes a practicable solution with the lowest emission wins the game. Different large wooden cubes are used for a vivid representation of the emissions.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Hoplomachus: Victorum ‚Äì Control ‚ÄòUr Roll Dice Tray
boardgame.description:
This neoprene tray features versions of Anthony LeTourneau’s beautiful Victorum box art on both sides, and like our other trays, it is *perfect* for protecting your table from those hefty alloy dice you already ordered!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cloudspire: Control 'Ur Roll Dice Tray
boardgame.description: This neoprene tray features beautiful Cloudspire box art.

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: Control ‚ÄòUr Roll Dice Tray
boardgame.description: This neoprene tray features TMB artwork.

boardgame.name: Mondgewitter
boardgame.description:
You place cards with clouds, green and yellow moons, lightning or black holes in a spiral on the crescent moon. In your turn, you lay a maximum of three cards and move your figure. Edges must match when you lay cards. If you cannot or do not want to lay cards, you draw a card. Restrictions apply to the laying of the individual motifs. Cards laid during the turn determine the movement range of the piece. At the end of the spiral, you turn around; on clouds, opposing pieces are captured and special rules apply again for some motifs. In a game of two, you win if you are not at the end of the spiral, otherwise you win if you have moved the furthest.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Horror on Tau Sigma 7
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Rare metal deposit [Key Type NM-109] detected on Tau Sigma 7.
Request ground team for site access and sample retrieval.

Hazard level 2.
Geology unstable.
Biology unconfirmed.

For enquiries regarding on-site injury or harmful exposure, consult Nakatomi Solutions’ Contractor Handbook article F-7: Corporate Accountability Waiver.

Before Dying Hard on Hardlight Station, you’ll have to survive The Horror on Tau Sigma 7...

The Horror on Tau Sigma 7 is a self-contained pamphlet adventure for the sci-fi horror RPG Mothership. A prequel to Dying Hard on Hardlight Station, use it to build suspense for your ongoing adventures or as a one-shot rife with alien mystery and subterranean terror. Inside you’ll find everything you need to dive into horror’s heart including:

Fully keyed custom location map with 10 unique locations.
Full-colour interior with original art by Vil and professional layout by Eric K. Hill.
A living alien environment that responds to the actions of your PCs.
Unique monsters, strange visions, bio-plastic artifacts, walls coursing with alien “lifeblood” and much more!

boardgame.name: ASTER
boardgame.description: ASTER is a game of intuition and spatial logic (for 2 to 4 players), in which you will have to generate, move on the map and destroy stars with a single objective: to reconstruct the constellations as we see them from the terrestrial perspective and claim them before the other players.

boardgame.name: Guardians of Fire
boardgame.description:
Guardians of Fire is an immersive combat exploration game for 2-5 players set in mythological ancient Persia.
It challenges 4 Heroes in chronicled adventures against the Angra Mainyu, the source of all evil.

The game system is an RPG / Dungeon-Crawl. There are six missions, and after each event, each player can improve their abilities and get more gifts.

At the end of each chronicle, 2 events will take place, and they depend on which side wins the game. The time for completing each mission is about 60-90 minutes.

Each game involves an action-packed fight where two sides face off. One of the players assumes the role of the dark side and controls the army of Ahriman. The remaining players take control of the Heroes, who must work together as a team to stop the darkness. Each side takes turns, pitting their strategies against each other in order to achieve their objectives.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Guardians of Fire: City of the Damned
Guardians of Fire: Holy Order
Guardians of Fire: Temple of Destiny

boardgame.name: Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws - Dweller's Guide Part 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws...This Pen and Paper is inspired by the Fallout franchise.
...
What the system offers is freedom in a literal fashion. The freedom to create the character of your dreams without the limitation of classes. Character creation comprises of point-buy. You put points into the skills and statistics of your choice to improve them to give you a higher possibility of succeeding in actions. The system revolves around percentile dice for the actions.

User summary:

Part 1 consists of character creation, level advancement, roleplaying, and combat.

boardgame.name: Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws - Dweller's Guide Part 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws...This Pen and Paper is inspired by the Fallout franchise.
...
What the system offers is freedom in a literal fashion. The freedom to create the character of your dreams without the limitation of classes. Character creation comprises of point-buy. You put points into the skills and statistics of your choice to improve them to give you a higher possibility of succeeding in actions. The system revolves around percentile dice for the actions.

User summary:

Part 2 consists of crafting, robot upgrades, cybernetics, implants, and vehicles.

boardgame.name: Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws - Bestiary
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The goal [of the Bestiary] is to include every possible creature and faction in the Fallout universe.

boardgame.name: Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws - Equipment
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Equipment [has been placed] in its own section to make laod time for the document faster.

boardgame.name: Fallout: Vaults & Deathclaws - Overseer's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A guide for those that wish to run their own Fallout Campaign. This guide covers some basics...All who wish to run a Fallout Campaign should read this document.

boardgame.name: Fallout Post Apocalyptic Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Fallout centers around a post-apocalyptic retro-future America. The tone of the setting is a cross between post-apocalypse-survival and 50s-era-atompunk. After World War II, the world advances the power of the atom, and uses up many of its natural resources in the process to create a variety of fusion powered comforts. When resources begin to run dry, hostilities around the world escalate, resulting in a catastrophic nuclear war. Some people managed to survive in the blasted wasteland of Post-war Earth, but others survived by paying for space in large underground Vaults constructed before the Cataclysm, Vaults built by an American corporation called “Vault-Tec”.

boardgame.name: The Other Realm
boardgame.description:
Everything has been fine since the age of Arthur, but now disaster has struck, the Wardstone has been stolen from the French and taken to The Other Realm, a place of twisted dreams, of nightmarish monsters and a perpetual twilight.

For years a secret cadre of keepers have made sure that the sacred Wardstones have remained secure, however unbeknownst to humanity there was another. This has remained in The Other Realm, and as its power has waxed and waned so has the access from one world to another. As it has grown in power in recent years so monstrous activity has increased across the known world, testing humanity and seeking the knowledge of the location of the others.

Here lies the mortal danger, should all of the Wardstones be taken to The Other Realm then the thin veil between worlds will be shattered and all humanity’s greatest fears will be set loose in the known world.

Only your band of experienced monster hunters are capable of taking one of the precious Wardstones and entering The Other Realm to retrieve the missing stone, while making sure that the remaining ones do not fall into other diabolical hands…

boardgame.name: Wild World Wrestling Main Event Edition
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

No. Holds. Barred.

This is where your imaginary personas do battle between the ropes, with nonstop action powered by innovative moves created on-the-fly by you.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Wild World Wrestling: Estrellas del Cuadril√°tero PDF

boardgame.name: Hamsters vs. Hippos
boardgame.description:
The hamsters have escaped their enclosure at the zoo and are making a run for it! Suddenly they come across a pond and see their most prized possession, the lily flower!

Unfortunately, lurking below the surface is a hippo waiting for his favorite snack. The hamsters have to take a risk and gather as many flowers as they can before all of the hippo's friends arrive to join in on the feast!

The game lasts 4 rounds with each player representing a little hamster. The player with the most flowers at the end of 4 rounds wins. Each round ends when hamster is eaten.

Each round, add another hippo card to the deck before shuffling and dealing the cards out. Since extra cards are placed to the side, the extra hippos may or may not be on the board.

The game goes 4 rounds, with the winner being the player with the most flowers collected during the game. If there is a tie after the 4th round, keep adding rounds (with the 4 hippo cards) until a winner is declared.

Playing a round:

A round ends as soon as a hippo card is flipped. Any hamsters that are still on grid when this card is flipped, lose all the flowers that they collected that round. Shuffle the cards adding a hippo, then deal out the next pond to start the next round.

Taking turns, each player ventures out onto a lily pad, starting by moving onto any card along the edge of the grid.

Each turn, they must either move, or spend 2 flowers to peak under an un-flipped card. If they move, they must move onto an adjacent card (including diagonals). When landing on that card, they can collect any flower that is on top of it, and then must flip the card and perform the action (if any) underneath. If there are flowers underneath, they collect those too from the flower pile. Once a card has been flipped, a player can no longer step back on to it. Player can take up to 2 moves per turn, no including forced moves made from flipped cards.

Players can move off the board (from any lily pad on the edge) to safety during their turn. If they do so, they are out for the remainder of that round, but keep anything they collected in their permanent storage

Players can keep going until a hippo card is flipped, or until the last player has moved out of the pond

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 25 : Interview with Jim Freeman and James Staley - Hamsters vs. Hippos
