boardgame.name: The Axis
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, you were only out for yourself. Many would consider you a bad guy- hell, much of the time you'd agree with them. But something happened - a turning point that made you realize some of the people you worked with didn't have your code. You only went after the big guys, but there were little guys out there being taken advantage of by people even
worse than you. And some of these people were too big to really pay a consequence, and the weak and helpless suffered.

But the one thing you can say about these big players- they might seem too big to fail, but just like a boulder at the top of a mountain, if you find the turning point a little force can bring it tumbling down. You put yourself in the business of finding The Axis.

boardgame.name: Glam Metal Monster Hunter
boardgame.description: Glam Metal Monster Hunter is an original zine-based, rules light TTRPG of Neon Knights and Denim Demons inspired by the Hair Metal, Video Nasty and Satanic Panic aesthetics of the 1980s.

boardgame.name: Claws of Crimson
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Word reaches the PCs that there was a great firefight around Vault 95 a few days back. Normally, it might be written off as typical raider conflict. However, when an eyewitness speaks of a mass movement of Deathclaws around that same time, the PCs are motivated to scout out the edge of the Glowing Sea to see what fresh hells the Wasteland is about to throw their way.

boardgame.name: Forbidden Depths
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs approach an ArcJet Systems office with the intent of doing what all good Wastelanders do: Loot everything of value inside. While avoiding and dismantling the potentially lethal automated defenses, they come across an active terminal. It reveals that a “deep-range transmitter” has been activated and is in contact with “Mars Outpost One”. A set of coordinates is provided, pointing the PCs towards the Nahant Oceanological Society.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as two PDF files:

13-page scenario
14-page print-and-play handouts

boardgame.name: A Real Pizza Work
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs are relaxing on an otherwise normal day in the Wasteland when they are approached by a strange woman who identifies herself as “the greatest chef in the Commonwealth”. She wishes to create a Pre-War dish known as a “Pizza”, and for that she’ll need the PCs to go to at least three locations to pick up ingredients. What starts as a silly diversion quickly turns serious as Raiders, Mirelurks, and more do everything in their power to prevent the creation of the first Pizza in centuries!

boardgame.name: Fallout New Orleans - 100 Random Encounters
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A d100 random table to generate interesting, concise encounters.

boardgame.name: Fallout - 100 More Encounters
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A d100 random table to generate interesting, concise encounters.

boardgame.name: Fallout - Exploration
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

These Exploration rules are used with a map divided into squares called exploration zones. An exploration zone is approximately 10 square miles.

boardgame.name: New Orleans Bestiary
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of various new monsters and opponents for use in the game.

boardgame.name: Fallout 2d20 Fan Made Bestiary
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of various new monsters and opponents for use in the game; this item includes most of the content presented in New Orleans Bestiary and adds better layout and additional monsters.

boardgame.name: Intelligent Deathclaws
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Like all good things, Intelligent Deathclaws are a type of Deathclaw that were experimented on by the Enclave in 2235. Exposing captured Deathclaws to FEV boosted their intelligence and gave them the ability to talk, among other perks. It was the Enclave’s hope that these mutated Deathclaws would be intelligent enough to obey orders without question. Naturally, that didn’t go so well.

boardgame.name: Fallout New Vegas 2d20 RPG Small Arms Armory
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of various types of special ammunition and weapons that might be available in the setting.

boardgame.name: Fallout the Roleplaying Game - A Miscellany of Weapons and Other Stuff
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of various types of special weapons and equipment that might be available in the setting.

boardgame.name: Fallout the RPG - Crafting Ammo
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of various types of ammunition with details about crafting, etc.

boardgame.name: Origin: Hairy Deathclaw (Shadowclaw)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a creature feared and respected throughout the Midwest, an engineered killing machine designed to be the perfect soldier for the pre-War American government. Closely related to the larger hairless Deathclaws found in the coastal regions, your ancestors were created from the common Deathclaw progenitor genetic blueprint to fulfill the military’s requirements for an animalistic super soldier. While your cousins (tarrasquis horribilis) were designed to be hulking, implacable monsters, your species (tarrasquis fidelis) was designed to be intelligent enough to understand orders but not enough to question them. In the Midwest, “Deathclaw is used to refer to the hairy variety, and the large coastal variety is a “Terrorclaw”. To whatever extent hairy Deathclaws are known outside the Midwest, they are known as “Shadowclaws”.

boardgame.name: Fallout Unwashed Assets - Monsters and NPCs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Fan content for Fallout 2d20 inspired by various Fallout sources.

boardgame.name: Scots Raid: A Solo Game
boardgame.description:
Set in the Dark Ages you command a small force of Scots raiding across the border into the lands of the Anglo-Saxons, the game is played over two scenarios the raid itself and the escape as you try to outrun the pursuing Anglo-Saxon forces.

Ideal for 28mm figures but can be played in any scale as long as the figures are individually based.

Simple to play but the random events should make every game different.

Turn Sequence:

Activate Scot forces
Activate Anglo-Saxon forces
Roll for Anglo-Saxon reinforcements
Roll for random events


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Gothic Ancestries & Cultures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spooky, playable ancestries & cultures, new magic items, monsters, and more for your Ravenloft games!

With 17 ancestries & cultures, including gothic monsters, weapons, and equipment!

Play as:

a headless horseman out of Sleepy Hollow,
Frankenstein's monster,
one who returned from an unjust death, like The Crow,
a ghost, and more!


Use magic items and equipment like:

the Eerie Tarot Deck,
Ouija Board of the Dead,
the Monkey's Paw, or
muskets and flintlocks!


Face horrific foes like:

the Eldritch Thing (inspired by The Thing) or
the Macabre Steed!

boardgame.name: Deathreach: An Introduction
Deathreach: The Beginning
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deathreach is an ongoing fantasy world released in several PDFs, detailing the commonwealth of Vihar and the surrounding townships which make this new frontier town on the edge of the world. This introductory PDF reveals the details of the first 58 years of history, including the characters who shaped the environment, and what gamemasters and players can expect in future PDFs.

This PDF includes a map, and enough to get started using this series. The next PDF in the series gets into the locations of Traitor's Bay, the largest settlement in the commonwealth.

Deathreach encourages gamemasters to share their gaming session stories with the author to be compiled into a year-end wrap up PDF revealing how Deathreach has changed since the settlement began.

Deathreach is system-neutral and perfectly suited for old and new styles of play.

boardgame.name: Essays on Empathy
boardgame.description:
Essays on Empathy is a curated compilation of Deconstructeam's best efforts in seeking new narrative experiences in games.

Inhabit the lives of a diverse cast of characters from all walks of life in bite-sized, innovative, interactive stories; from a hitman working at a flower shop, to a schoolgirl who is convinced her skeleton isn't hers.

Explore 10 unique, offbeat tales including "De Tres al Cuarto," a brand new short experience exclusive to the compilation about a couple of two-bit comedians trying to make it big.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Shoeby Card Game
boardgame.description:
The game contains cards with numbers and 'actions' printed on them, in several colors plus a few jokers.

This game is closely related to Crazy Eights, UNO, KFC's Assano and KFC's Actiespel.
General game-play and basic rules are the same those games, the take-that cards might be different from specific versions of those games.

The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own hand cards first. To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match on of your own cards with the color or symbol of the last played card. Jokers are always valid to play, if you have them. If you can't match, you draw a card from a shared draw pile. If you can match that card, you can instantly play it.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

3 Cards with the rules in Dutch.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color yellow.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color blue.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color green.
9 Cards with number 1-9, plus 1 "buy-2" card, 1 "skip turn" card and 1 "reverse direction" card, in the color red.
4 Colorless Cards with additional actions, 2 "take-4" cards, 3 "change color" card.


This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the Shoeby clothes stores.

—user summary

boardgame.name: This World You Live in is Not a Place for People like You
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A journaling game about crash landing on an alien power and trying to survive against all odds

From the introduction:

Distant future. You are a captain of a relatively small trusty space shuttle, traversing the depths of space in the name of the Space Federation, money or whatever else inspires people to explore the galaxy nowadays.
boardgame.rpg: This World You Live in is Not a Place for People like You

boardgame.name: Battle of the Bands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battle of the Bands features a high school band in a battle of the bands contest in the mid eighties. They have to win a preliminary round and then the finals to get the big prize, a single released by Capitol Records of their own original songs.

Contains pre-generated characters and the setup for eight bands and two venues.

Battle of the Bands is a one shot adventure, meant to be finished in one session.

boardgame.name: The Mermaid's Jewels: String Together A Treasure From The Sea
boardgame.description:
Mermaids have been swimming through the magical sea, collecting colorful jewels along the way. They have an overflowing treasure chest full of “pearls” and want you to join in on the fun. Can you string together enough of these treasures from
the sea to make your very own necklace?

Roll the die and collect pearls from the special, pearl-sorting treasure chest. Once you remove a pearl, all the other pearls will cascade down the lane. Look closely! Did any of the pearls form a chain reaction with two or more of the same colored pearls touching?

The first player to complete their necklace wins!

For a more challenging game, you can add the dangerous, dark green, seaweed colored pearls to the treasure chest. You’ll need to avoid getting “caught in the seaweed” and complete your necklace to win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Fall of Silverpine Watch
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Fall of Silverpine Watch is an introductory D&D adventure module for three to five players and one GM. It’s specifically designed to help inexperienced GMs hone the skills they learned in Game Angry: How to RPG the Angry Way. It’s also a great way for experienced GMs to introduce new players to role-playing games and even experienced groups can enjoy this standalone adventure.

While escorting a merchant through the alpine forests of Asternia, the heroes find that the titular fortress, Silverpine Watch, has barred it’s gates to travelers. Inside the fortress, the heroes must deal with undead abominations risen from the Watch’s former garrison and the vengeful ghost of the Watch’s commander.

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Guide to Korvidas
boardgame.description:
"A small, heavily forested realm, Korvidas is dotted with farms and small towns. Yet this is no ordinary place. Dark shapes prowl the forests of this domain, while scarecrows stand quietly amidst the towns and farms, watching and listening.

A Darklord sits alone in his manor, cursed to become what he had spent a lifetime hunting. An undead rival waits patiently in the wings. And a secret society places hope on the arrival of adventurers.

The domain of Korvidas is in need of heroes. Will you answer the call?

In this product, you will find:

a description of the domain of Korvidas and its Darklord, including key locations and a random encounter table
statistics for several new creatures, including the Darklord and other NPCs
a introductory mini-adventure for characters that are level 2
several adventure seeds that can be joined together into a mini-campaign
new magic items and a new character option (lineage): the moon cursed."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Food Truck Race
boardgame.description:
The city has decided to limit food trucks down to only one. That means the drivers/chefs have one day to race around downtown serving food on the fly to hungry customers to prove that their truck is the only one that deserves to stay in business.

Players have to manage their prep areas while racing to customers all over the downtown sidewalks in order to serve the most customers they can until everyone is fed. Each item on your truck has a set price, so you can keep track of how much money you're making in sales as the game progresses...

But there's more. At the end of the night, every food truck flips over the order cards that they delivered during the game and adds the tips to their haul of cash. Orders with a variety of items earn more tips, and the player driving the food truck with the most money wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Bagration ‚Äì Axis-Allies: Hungarian, Romanian and Finnish forces on the Eastern Front 1944
boardgame.description:
This book contains:

Background on the Finnish, Hungarian, and Romanian Armies during the epic battles for the Eastern Front in 1944 and 1945.
Instructions on how to build a Finnish T-26 Armoured Company, Sturmi Assault Gun Company and Infantry Company, or a Hungarian Panther Tank Company, Tiger Tank Company, Turán Tank Company, Panzer IV Tank Company, Zrinyi Assault Gun Company, StuG Assault Gun Company, Hetzer Assault Gun Company and Rifle Company, or a Romanian R-2 Light Tank Company, T-4 Medium Tank Company, TA Assault Gun Company, and Motorised Rifle Company.
Painting and Basing guides.
Three new Bagration themed Missions.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

listing.notes:
Bagration: Axis Allies
In 1944 Stalin‚Äôs Red army is on the attack. While it throws the Germans out of Byelorussia, it also goes about defeating Germany‚Äôs allies; Finland, Romania and Hungary. The Romanians hold off the first Soviet attacks, but a second massive offensive in August 1944 sees them overwhelmed. They surrender and swap sides to fight alongside the Soviets.
Meanwhile, the Finns also fight for their survival as the Soviets attempt to steamroll them out of the war. They fight the Soviets to a standstill and agree a peace, but are forced to turn on the Germans.

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Hungarian Starter Force ‚Äì Assault Gun Battery
boardgame.description:
In 1944 Stalin’s Red army is on the attack.
While it throws the Germans out of Byelorussia, it also goes about defeating Germany’s allies; Finland, Romania and Hungary.
The Romanians hold off the first Soviet attacks, but a second massive offensive in August 1944 sees them overwhelmed. They surrender and swap sides to fight alongside the Soviets.
Meanwhile, the Finns also fight for their survival as the Soviets attempt to steamroll them out of the war. They fight the Soviets to a standstill and agree a peace, but are forced to to turn on the Germans.
Then three massive Soviet Fronts turn on Hungary, defended by six German and Hungarian armies. The great red sledgehammer is soon swinging, as the Soviets and Romanians launch an assault toward Budapest. Axis armoured forces attempt to stop the encirclement of the city. This savage and bitter struggle will last for 100 gruelling days.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: After the Rain
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

After the Rain is a minimal prep one-shot roleplaying game where you build your character by losing what makes you, you.

boardgame.name: States of the USA
boardgame.description: Players identify states based on their flag, capitol, shape, or landmark. If a player correctly identifies a state, they get to answer a trivia question about the state.

boardgame.name: Budget Cuts 2: Mission Insolvency
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Budget Cuts 2 is a VR game that continues the story where Budget Cuts left off. Navigate through TransCorp as you attempt to prevent the robots from optimizing humans out of existence.

boardgame.name: Space Knight
boardgame.description:
A long time ago in an RPG not so far away.…


Play as a knight from your favorite science fantasy franchise including the use of an energy sword in this supplement to use with LIGHT. Also included are 2 foes for GMs to use against Space Knights to give that epic feel of defending the galaxy.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dynamic Weather Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Weather affects many aspects of an adventurer's life, from slowing travel to making armor unbearable to wear for long periods. But how do you create a realistic dynamic weather pattern to simulate a realistic world? Well, never fear, your friends at Healing Fireball are here to help. With the tables in this product you can create a unique weather pattern for each day. With 7 Weather filled tables covering everything from humidity to cloud cover. Plus a bonus section about generating extreme weather patterns.

boardgame.name: Caesar!
Caesar!: Emparez vous de Rome en 20 minutes!
Caesar!: Ovl√°dnƒõte ≈ò√≠m ve 20 minut√°ch
Caesar!: Seize Rome in 20 Minutes!

boardgame.description:
The Roman Republic is coming to an end, but not before a power struggle between Caesar and Pompey. Players will command their legions, strategically deploying them to key battlegrounds to try and seize control of the provinces and become ruler of the republic.

Players draw tokens from a bag to determine their starting forces and to replenish their losses. Players allocate their resources to each province, gaining tactical advantages and vying for control of the republic.

Three modules to expand the game are included, poison your opponent, deploy powerful Centurions and use underhanded tactics to gain advantages in the Expansions of Rome.

boardgame.name: Pincremental
boardgame.description: Steam description - Become the Pinball Wizard you were destined to be! Master the pinball machine, cash out for powerful upgrades and automation, and climb the corporate ladder in this Pinball Incremental.

boardgame.name: Slay the Spire: The Board Game
boardgame.description: Slay the Spire is a cooperative deckbuilding adventure. Craft a unique deck, encounter bizarre creatures, discover relics of immense power, and finally become strong enough to Slay the Spire!

boardgame.name: Cyber Ops
boardgame.description: Steam description - Become a military hacker and help your black ops team reach their goal in this noir cyberpunk tactical game. Scan, hack, overtake, control and manage high tech devices, vehicles and even enemy cyborgs with cutting-edge implants.

boardgame.name: For the People
boardgame.description: Steam description - For the People is a mix of a political management sim and a visual novel, putting players in the shoes of an idealistic young state official tasked with shaping the future of a communist factory town. Will the party provide for the people, or are the people just cogs in its machine?..

boardgame.name: Recursed
boardgame.description: Steam description - A puzzle game where the rooms are items and the items are rooms. Get to the goal by moving, rearranging and duplicating rooms and altering the structure of the world.

boardgame.name: Semblance
boardgame.description: Steam description - Semblance is an innovative platformer with deformable terrain, set in a beautiful minimalist world. It’s a game that asks, what if you could deform and reshape the world itself? Semblance takes the idea of a ‘platform’ in a platformer and turns it on its head.

boardgame.name: „Éô„Çπ„Éà„Éï„É¨„É≥„ÉâShiitake. (BestFriendShiitake.)
boardgame.description:
BestFriendShiitake. is a special version of BestFriendS; a game that players can get to know more about each other by trying to come up with the answer that would best satisfy the question giver. The BestFriendShiitake. includes a special supplement book written by Shiitake., the Japanese popular fortune teller, and can be enjoyed as a psychological test.

In this game, players take turns one by one, and become a question giver. The giver draws a question card randomly from the draw pile, and announces the question written on it. There are questions like "What do I think is the must have food for picnic?" or "What do I want?" Other players write the answers that would most please the question giver according to the giver’s character and taste, and submit it to the giver. For example, you could write sandwitches, rice balls, or summer rolls for must have food for picnic.

When everyone's answers are submitted, the giver shuffles the answers and then looks at them secretly. This is the best moment in this game! Looking at the answers everyone wrote to please you makes you happy and blushing.

The giver ranks the answers depending on their subjectivity, reveals and announces the answers from the least accurate without identifying who has written what. It would be more fun if you comment when you reveal an answer. Lastly, announce the best one. Only the person who wrote that answer claims it, and they get the question card as a point.

Keep doing this, and the game ends after certain rounds. The person with the most question cards is the winner.

boardgame.name: Once More Into the Void
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter Subtitle:
A science-fiction roleplaying game of bringing the family back together for one last job.

Kickstarter Story:
Story
We were comrades, we were family.

We were once the heroes of this galaxy. We stood against the tide of darkness and prevailed, again and again.

But our family fell apart. Our shared past is full of shame, trespasses, and secrets. We parted ways, vowing to never see each other again.

And now, our greatest enemy has returned. Manipulating from the shadows, they grow stronger than ever. No one else believes the threat is real. Only the Captain has a chance at defeating this enemy, once and for all. But the Captain can't do it alone.

It's time for the crew to come together again, just like old times. But will they go into the void once more? Can the crew trust the Captain again, who left disappointment and heartbreak in their wake?

Last page includes License:
License: Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0)

boardgame.name: Ëµ§„ÅÑÁ≥∏Â§ß‰ΩúÊà¶ (Secret Admirer)
boardgame.description:
Secret Admirer is a game to send tiny letters to each other. Succeed the destiny challenge by confessing your love to someone who you believe sent you a love letter, or meddle in and try to hook other 2 players up.

On your turn, you send one of your letters to someone by tucking it to their post. The person who received it cannot look inside the letter yet.

Each player has 5 letters, and 2 of them are love letters. You send a love letter to someone who you like secretly. While players send letters to each other, if you think the person you sent a love letter also sent you a love letter back, then be brave and confess your love.

If they love you back, then you two try “love love challenge” and see if you can have everyone's celebration.

But be careful! If you are too shy, someone might meddle in!

boardgame.name: „Éä„É≥„ÉÜ„ÉÉ„Çø (Nantetta)
boardgame.description:
Nantetta is a game of imagination. The title “Nantetta” means “What did you say?” in Japanese.

The active player chooses one of the cards on the table at heart. They think of the phrase that would go in the words balloon of that card, and announce it. Imagine in your own way by observing the character's expression and situation. What kind of phrase would be suitable to tell the feelings you came up with?

Other players imagine the feelings from the announced phrase, and search for the card that would be correct. The way the active player said it can be a hint. Look at the cards on the table carefully, and if you think you found it, take it as fast as possible. If you take the correct one, you get that card as a reward.

Players take turns one by one, imagining the feelings from the picture, and announce the phrase freely. Other players may sympathize, or get surprised.
Continue doing this, and the person who gets 5 cards first is the winner.
There's no wrong phrases or right phrases. It's important to announce the phrase you came up with.

On the other hand, you would feel very happy if others sympathize and understand what you meant. This experience of being understood helps them to think of the phrases that people can understand naturally.

boardgame.name: „Åô„Åö„ÇÅÈõÄ„Éó„É¨„Ç§„Éû„ÉÉ„Éà (Suzume-Jong: Playmat)
boardgame.description:
A playmat made for playing Suzume-Jong comfortably. Suzume-jong is a minimal reinvented Japanese style mahjong.
75×60cm big, 1.5mm thick. Made with rubber. The surface is polyester.
It's smooth, and lessens the noise of tiles. By using this playmat, it becomes easier to mix tiles and play Suzume-jong.
Made of a soft, high-grade material that does not bend or wrinkle. It always becomes flat after unfolding.

boardgame.name: Missione Natura
boardgame.description:
Missione Natura Is a card game in which the player has to save more endangered animals he can.
At each turn one animal has to be played but only the more endangered or if they have the same value, the heavier wins.
Animals are also divided in habitats, so if animals of the same habit are played the last one wins independent of weight and endangered state.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jackal Archipelago: Friday's island
boardgame.description: Jackal Archipelago: Friday’ island is a new island for Jackal: Archipelago. It includes 11 new tiles, 4 coins, 4 bottles and Friday meeple.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Jackal Archipelago

boardgame.name: Stonelight: The Crazy Magic Tournament
boardgame.description:
Be part of a crazy magic tournament, where the chaos rules and up to 6 participants simultaneously collect resources and cast spells on each other, trying to sabotage each other's plans to collect 6 Magic Stones and win the game.

Stonelight is a fun-to-play game for 2 to 6 players in which everyone plays with unique Characters and Magic Familiars with the objective of collecting 6 Magic Stones before anyone else. The game is full of funny and mean spells awakening intense emotions and creating amusing moments during the entire match. Stealing resources and Magic Stones, changing the target of other people's spells, or creating big hurricanes to mess with everyone's Magic Stones is a usual thing in this game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Thorvin's Superweapon
Thorvin's Wonder Weapon
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

An old friend has developed a breathtaking machine and invites adventurers to take a look at it. The journey there is arduous and leads through a mountain range in which orcs lurk for careless travelers. But even after their arrival there are problems - the disputes between the various dwarf clans in the city threaten to escalate. When Thorvin's miracle weapon is stolen, it is entirely up to the adventurers to prevent the worst, uncover the truth behind everything and help their friend.

boardgame.name: Pocket World Cup: The Rise of Antarctica
boardgame.description:
Global warming has transformed Antarctica from a winter wasteland into a holiday hotspot. As visitors flock to this newly-formed island nation, the governing authorities are looking to make a splash on the global stage and entice people to take up permanent residence. What better way to showcase this beautiful country than by becoming a world power in the beautiful game? Take the reins of the national football squad, use a recruiting loophole to pick some of the best players from around the globe, and lead Antarctica to World Cup glory in this challenging card-drafting, dice-chucking game for one!

In Pocket World Cup, you will play the role of team manager leading Antarctica through three years of World Cup qualifying. Each year you will draft 3 new players to your team and face 3 opponents in an attempt to earn momentum. Games are resolved by rolling dice for both sides, with each player offering additional dice or the ability to manipulate the dice in play. The players will get better as you progress from one year to the next, but so will your competition. If you earn enough momentum after three years, you will qualify for the World Cup: a 24-team single-elimination knockout tournament.

For a greater challenge, you can play in Dynasty Mode: a campaign of four complete cycles of qualifying games and World Cups in which you earn victory points based on how far you advance each cycle. Earn enough and your name will be etched forever in the Antarctican Hall of Fame!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ostfriesen Roulette
boardgame.description:
Each player receives 5 dice. Whoever has dice left at the end loses, everyone else wins.
A player starts by rolling 2 dice. If he throws a double, he must take them back. If he throws different numbers, they remain and he may throw one more of his remaining dice or pass. Then the other players follow. Every time a 6 is thrown, that die is removed from the game. If a number occurs twice, the player must take these dice back into his hand and it is the next player's turn.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Eastern Empires
boardgame.description:
Eastern Empires is a board game for 3 to 9 players and covers the development of ancient civilizations over 8000 years of history. Eastern Empires can take up to 12 hours to complete, and still yet, it has a simple mechanism and is easy to learn. The players lead their civilizations, as they expand and collapse, from the Stone Age, through the Bronze Age to the end of the Iron Age. Eastern Empires provides a full day of fun for larger groups.

Culture
Though it may seem at first glance, Eastern Empires is not a wargame. Yes, conflict may be involved, but rather it is a game about history, culture, trade, development, and... calamities. The civilizations involved are all situated along the Silk Road and the Arabian Peninsula. The Babylonians, The Indus Valley civilization and The Nubians. Players develop their own unique civilization in arts, crafts, science, civics and religion. Each player starts his civilization with a single population token, 8000 BC, but grows and grows over time, and eventually cities can be built. Cities of course bring wealth and fortune, but also… natural calamities such as epidemics, famine or earthquakes, or civil calamities such as pirate attacks, slave revolts and civil disorder.

Trading
This wealth is expressed in trade cards. The more cities, the more cards a player gets. These cards provide both trading commodities, and calamities. Trading is the heart of the game. A real social experience, where all players simultaneously trade with each other during a limited time. As soon as trading has ended, the players that end up with calamities will suffer them.

Develop advances
And then, of course, it's time to do something about it. Build walls, give your citizens music and architecture. Develop religion, democracy, improve science… 51 different advances can be developed in five different categories.

Maybe a player can even construct a wonder of the world, or scatter their people all over the map, and gain cultural ascendancy. The player that knows best how to work together, trade or battle for territory, defend his people against nature or enemies like barbarian hordes, and stand the test of time, eventually will win the game. After up to 12 hours of playing that is.

Additional components
Compared to its counterpart Western Empires (2019), Eastern Empires game adds additional components and scenarios that enable games with less than 5 players. Though the base game is especially designed for interaction between larger numbers, these new rules and components provide a well balanced smaller game that can even be used with its counterpart Western Empires. The game can be expanded with Eastern Empires: The Special Buildings Expansion (2019).

Mega Empires
When combining the board games Western Empires (2019) and Eastern Empires (2021) this forms: Mega Empires (2021), an 18-player experience. A full game of Mega Empires takes up to 13 hours to complete. This bundle contains both stand alone games, each of which can be played by 3-9 players and can be expanded with the two Special Buildings Expansions (2019) for either game or the combination of both games. Where Western Empires has a focus on sea travel and trade on the Mediterrainean Sea, Eastern Empires follows the Silk Road to India and trading is done through the deserts of the Arabian Peninsula.

—description from the designers

boardgame.name: Daniel und seine Freunde
boardgame.description:
The players move their game pieces along a route by rolling the dice and experience some events from the life of the prophet Daniel. In addition, 2 non-player figures move, the lion and the fire, which prevent the players from moving forward. On the way, lion cards and name cards can be collected, which bring additional points at the end of the game. The game ends when 2 players or 1 player and the lion figure have reached the goal, for which points are awarded. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Battletech: MapPack ‚Äì Battle of Tukayyid
boardgame.description:
The map pack includes the following:

Four double sized, two sided map sheets

Deployment Zone
Kozice Valley (CDS)
Lake Losije (CNC)
Holth Forest (CGB)
Racice River Delta (CSJ)
Pozoristu Mountains (CW)
Robyn's Crossing (CJF)
Devil's Bath (CSV)


1 punchboard of fire and smoke counters
Location rulesheet
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
Battletech: Battle of Tukayyid
BattleTech: Beginner Box
Battletech: Clan Invasion

boardgame.name: Memorization Contraindications
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for tools to make your game better? Download and put these pandects into your Dungeon Master tools to help you run an manage games.

This issue?

The original magic-user had a very limited spell list with spells that were very focused on utility in a dungeon.
The original magic-user only had 8 first level spells, 10 second level spells, and 14 third level spells.They have 12 fourth level spells, 14 fifth level spells and 12 sixth level spells.
This gives them a grand total of 70 spells
A magic user in a second edition game has access to over 2,174 spells.
So how do the effects of magic help solve this problem? They introduce costs into being a wizard. Yes, they also give the wizard “extra power” but they do so unilaterally, meaning, also while you are walking through town or the dungeon, not just in combat.
Do you have protection from evil memorized? Congratulations on leaving a trail of chalk dust through the dungeon. Memorize water breathing? drooling next to the fighter while he talks with hobgoblins is going to weird them out. Do you have Wall of Fire prepared? Enjoy your walk through small villages with exclusively wooden buildings.

boardgame.name: Strategie 2000
boardgame.description:
Like in Chess, 2 players sit opposite each other and lead their pieces from an oil company (tankers, pipelines, oil tanks, drilling rigs, company boss and general manager) on an 8x8 board. The figures are assigned short (1 or 2) steps or long (any number) steps. At the beginning of each turn, a player receives income for some of his remaining figures and can then move 2 figures, but must pay for their movement. Opposing pieces are captured as in chess, but can be bought back. As soon as his group leader has been defeated or the player can no longer pay for piece movement, he loses.

—user summary

Drop me a line for further information.
Payment by bank transfer (SEPA: IBAN & BIC). You can use paypal adding 7% fee.

boardgame.name: La 24 Ore di Paperopoli
boardgame.description:
The 24 Ore di Paperopoli is a board game for 2 to 6 players: you will be driving one of the cars of the most famous characters of Paperopoli (DuckBurg) and you will have to compete to finish the race before your opponents. During the game you will have to use the cards at your disposal, choosing every turn two among the three at your disposal, to move and maneuver, overcoming the difficulties of the path and the opponents. All players have the same cards but how to use them and when to use your superpowers will make a difference.

Every card has a numeric value and a maneuver; one of the cards played use the numeric value and the other one the maneuver. Which cards to play and how to use? Everytime you play two cards with the same number you can activate a superpower but it has to be readied in the turns before using the Power maneuver.

Difficult terrain, disks and slipstream overtaking add strategic elements to the game that must be taken into account in order to win.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Endless Odyssey: A Mythic Storytelling Card Game
Die endlose Odyssee: Mythische Geschichten mit Bildkarten erz√§hlen
Nekoneƒçn√° Odysea
boardgame.description:
Fire your imagination with these fun Endless Odyssey storytelling cards. Reviving the Victorian craze for ‘myrioramas’, the 20 picture cards can be placed in any order to create seamless scenes. Almost infinite combinations of cards provide endless storyscaping possibilities.

Enter a strange land of winged horses and vengeful gods, where one-eyed monsters feast on human flesh. Perhaps you will stumble across buried treasure or receive a favourable prophecy, but watch out for the sinister boatman. He is waiting to transport you across the river, a journey from which no one has ever returned … Where will the story take you?

There are over two quintillion storyscaping possibilities, and you can build a seamless panorama stretching up to 5 1/2 feet!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: War Dog
boardgame.description:
The balloon went up, and came back down again, and now only you and your crew remain. The war is over. You need to get home.


War Dog uses Chris Bissette's Wretched & Alone system with a twist: you're not alone. You have your crew and your tank. Is this enough to survive the immediate aftermath of the Third World War?

Written by a former US Army M1 Abrams tank crewman, War Dog is a game about journeys and those who accompany us along the way.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: 90 Jahre IDT
boardgame.description:
The players roll the dice and must bring their two pieces to the finish. Other pieces can be captured and have to start again. The player may decide which of his figures is moved. Events flavoured by IDT company lurk along the way. The player who gets both pieces to the finish line wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Drakar och demoner: Gigant F√§ltslagsregler
boardgame.description: In 1987, the expansion "Gigant" came for the Swedish role-playing game "Drakar och demoner". The expansion contains rules for field battles that can be played with the role-playing game or separately. All that is needed is paper, pencil and dice. You can play with troops consisting of elves, dwarves, wolfmen, ratmen, centaurs, goblin wolfriders, lizardmen and more. The battles goes down in the Swedish fantasy world Ereb Altor.

boardgame.name: Martian Dome Ships
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Starship Builder Kit has been designed to allow you to utilize various stylized starship sections to compile your very own custom starship deckplan. You can use any graphics editing software that support PNG format to combine the piec-es, drop them directly into your favorite virtual tabletop (VTT) application, or even print and cut them out to be put together to make a tabletop play map.

This series of kits is designed to allow you to mix-and-match any of the sections included herein with sections included in other sets in the series.

Herein you will find over 20 ship sections including three sample ships built utilizing the included resources are area sections.

With Starship Builder Kits it is easy to create your own high-quality starship deckplans!

boardgame.name: Stories from the Slough
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the festering swamp. The odd bog. The Seeping Slough. A weird swamp hex-crawl adventure that will have players exploring a dangerous location that contains two dungeons, a village, several unique characters, monsters, and whimsical filth.

This is an adventure for any fantasy or magical post-apocalyptic roleplaying game. Players can be any level from low to middle tier characters, but higher-level characters may find the bog just as fun to explore, albeit with less danger.

What's in the adventure?

19 Hexes to explore: Each hex is a mile-wide stretch of swamp, and requires one hour to trudge through.
2 Dungeons: Each takes only a page for the map, and a few pages for the content. A witches cabin larger on the inside, and a gaping wound that leads into the behemoth that rots under the swamp.
6 Special NPC Stories: There are more than 6 characters in the adventure, but these six are special. They have their own story to explore, their own goals and quests, and really make the adventure feel alive.
Several factions: Factions ranging from the strange but peaceful villagers to blood worshiping cultists to followers of a plant god.

boardgame.name: The Slough Survival Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Slough: Survival guide is an addition to the Stories from the Slough zine. It adds additional encounters to the swamp with an emphasis on survival, food, and the environment. Each hex has its own goodies to find, depending on the theme of that location.

boardgame.name: The Slough: Beasts and Beauties
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Slough: Beasts and Beauties is an expansion to Stories from the Slough. In this zine you will find expanded information, statistics, and art of the many monsters in the Slough. This book is not required to play Stories of the Slough, and these monsters can be used outside of the swamp as well. It should be relatively simple to place these beasts in any dungeon or environment.

boardgame.name: Galactic Encounters Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

All role-playing game systems present a "default setting," that is, the "world" of the game. Some games even present more than one such setting. Most classic and modern fantasy RPGs are developed from a common Eurocentric fantasy setting that mashes together the works of J.R.R. Tolkein, Jack Vance, Michael Moorcock, and to a lesser degree other classic authors of fantasy fiction. Most science fiction role-playing games, on the other hand, are set in some recognized literary, television, or cinematic universe; the sad thing about this is that, in such a universe, the heroes are already known quantities. No matter how dashing or capable an adventurer in one of these games might be, he or she will never be the true hero of the story, and this fact can be very disappointing.

But what can be done about this? Unlike fantasy worlds, where we have common traditions and myths to give them flavor, a science fictional universe generally depends on some work of fiction for its flavor. There is no common science fictional universe, it would seem.

This is not so. Before the rebirth of science fiction on TV and in the movies, which started in the late 1960's and really didn't get rolling for another decade, there was one commonly-understood science fictional universe: epic space opera, set in a human-dominated galaxy. Curiously, while authors such as Isaac Asimov and E.E. "Doc" Smith are famous at least in part for their galactic civilizations, Jack Vance was one of the most prolific writers of works set in a human-dominated Milky Way galaxy. His works in particular present a galaxy too large to be governed by any one central authority, with far too many inhabited planets to comprehend, and unlike many later fictional works, his books often featured people and stories spanning mere handfuls of worlds. In such a galaxy you can find almost any adventure, and there is room enough for an endless variety of heroes and villains.

So that is the default, implied setting of this book: a human-dominated galaxy. Player characters presented in this book will be human, more or less, living human lives on worlds sometimes green and pleasant, sometimes weird or inhospitable.

Some Game Masters may wish to incorporate aliens, mutant or genetically engineered humans, or perhaps even robots or androids as player characters. This book explicitly omits them, for the sake of simplicity; we plan to include such characters in supplementary works. Whether or not any Game Master chooses to allow such characters depends entirely on what kind of galactic civilization he or she wishes to present. Are humans the only species with FTL travel? Indeed, are they the only sentient species in the galaxy? Or perhaps humans are just one of many species exploring space, fighting or trading for habitable worlds and other resources.

The galaxy is huge, and the possibilities are endless. Strap on your blaster and climb aboard your starship, for adventure awaits among the stars!

boardgame.name: Axe Cop Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You enter a world written by a five year old. While normally this would sound like a bad thing it's a bit more entertaining than you'd think. The world is full of enemies and allies you couldn't even fathom, sentient poop, cyclopean kings of evil, rabbit demons that possess people, crystal spawning night creatures from space, you'll be busy no matter what you do. That being said, you'll probably need something to help you from having your head chopped off.

boardgame.name: Heroic Visions (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A role playing game is very different from traditional games like chess or checkers. With other games, the goal is straight forward - beat your opponent. The goal of a role playing game is primarily to have fun and secondarily for your player characters to survive and defeat their adversaries. These adversaries are not the other player characters but characters known as NPC's (Non Player Characters) who are under the Game Master's (otherwise known as GM) control. Role playing games are cooperative; the players work together as a group or a team and not against each other. The players learn the fundamentals of teamwork as they work to survive in worlds of their Game Master's intricate design. This means that there is no winning and losing in the conventional sense. The players win or lose as a group. The GM and the players both having a good time is the only "win" possible.

boardgame.name: Heroic Visions (4th Ed)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It's 10:30 PM. A wintery wind whistles through the streets of Arcadia City. A young couple, hand in hand, meanders down the street lost in giggling conversation. They are unaware of the danger that lurks in the shadows. But that's where you come in. Perched on the roof top you see the muggers hastily mutter their plans. The glint of moonlight on metal indicates their intent more clearly than an orange neon sign. Exhaling slightly, you leap from your perch and enter the breach once again...

The world needs heroes. With Heroic Visions, the Superhero Role Playing Adventure Game, you can create your own Champion of Truth, Justice and the Galactic Way. You choose his origins and motivations: from a grim urban knight to an orphan from an alien planet. You customize your hero by selecting his Body Type, Origin, Advantages and Traits.
